configuration/registry.h

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /**
00002  * @file configuration/registry.h
00003  *
00004  * This module allows to store to and retrieve configuration values from a
00005  * persistent storage device. It uses the storage/persistent.h interface for all
00006  * read/write operations.
00007  *
00008  * @todo  Define the values in the \c CONFIG_KEY enum.
00009  * @todo  Should we make this interface more generic and not define the config
00010  *        keys using enum values? This woul allow for non hard coded keys but
00011  *        we loose compile-time error checking.
00012  *        If we change the interface in the described way, there will be the
00013  *        need for a \c config_clear function.
00014  * @todo  The two get/set functions are very generic and involve a relatively
00015  *        large amount of code to be used, wouldn't it be better to define the
00016  *        different types of the configuration directives (mainly strings and
00017  *        ints) and to offer type-specific getters and setters (i.e.
00018  *        \c config_get_int)?
00019  */
00020 
00021 
00022 #pragma once
00023 #include "../storage/persistent.h"
00024 
00025 
00026 /**
00027  * Defines the different available configuration directives. This keys can be
00028  * used to get or set configuration values with the \c config_get and
00029  * \c config_set functions.
00030  */
00031 enum CONFIG_KEY {
00032     DUMMY_CONFIG_KEY
00033 };
00034 
00035 
00036 /**
00037  * Reads the value identified by \a key argument from the config registry
00038  * and writes it to the memory area pointed to by \a buffer.
00039  *
00040  * @param[in]  key     The key of the configuration directive to read.
00041  * @param[out] buffer  The pointer to the memory area to which the value has
00042  *                     to be written.
00043  *
00044  * @return  0 if the value was read correctly, a negative error code otherwise.
00045  */
00046 int config_get(enum CONFIG_KEY key, void * buffer);
00047 
00048 
00049 /**
00050  * Sets the value identified by \a key to the content of \a buffer.
00051  *
00052  * @param[in] key     The key of the configuration directive to read.
00053  * @param[in] buffer  The pointer to the memory area from which the value has
00054  *                    to be read.
00055  *
00056  * @return  0 if the value was set correctly, a negative error code otherwise.
00057  */
00058 int config_set(enum CONFIG_KEY key, const void * buffer);
